Lisa rose up onto her two bare feet and lifted up the towel to cover her front, staring into the woods with her naked ass pointing towards the lake. Clearly, whoever had stolen her stuff wanted her to follow that trail. Part of her told her to do anything but that, to wrap the towel around her and run in the opposite direction until she hit a house, or a camp, anyplace where she could be around other people and call the cops. But another part of her was angry and vengeful. That part of her wanted her knife. It wanted to venture into the woods and get her things back all by itself. Working herself up, she decided that the most important thing she could do was to grab her knife. She could still run, but it was her only means of protecting herself, and who knows, maybe the trail would continue into items of clothing past the tree line. Maybe this invisible irritant was a punk who just wanted to watch her run around naked for a bit and nothing more. In any case, she wrapped the towel around herself and began walking carefully in the direction of the knife.

As she followed the trail, it soon became apparent that her towel was far too long and cumbersome for her current purposes. If she had to actually put her knife to use in self defense, the long soft covering would hinder her movement and make her vulnerable. Still, it was the closest thing to clothing she had at the moment, so she was reluctant to give it up. Soon enough Lisa found herself standing over the knife. Dreadfully suspecting that something was going to jump out of the woods and grab her, she bent over quick as a flash and snatched up the blade, standing firm and ready for anything.

Instead, she was greeted with nothing. Nothing but the typical peaceful sounds of nature, wind blowing through the trees, birds chirping, all mocking her present predicament with their placid regularity. Shoring up her courage, Lisa approached the edge of the woods, knife in hand and looked around. In the distance, but still in her line of sight, she saw what looked like her shirt, snagged along the branch of a tree. She wanted to run to it, snatch it from the fragile looking branch and pull it on, but she knew better. It could be a trap. So instead, she approached cautiously. When she was about halfway there however, she was startled by the unmistakable sound of the snapping of a twig, and the rustling of leaves.

Lisa turned on a dime to face the direction she believed the sound had come from. “Who’s there!?” She shouted as the towel that wrapped around her came unglued and crumpled to the floor. She didn’t pay it much mind, stepping out of the pool of soft material, and all but forgetting about the lost and found shirt she was leaving behind. Plunging forward, naked into the bush, Lisa kept her weapon at the ready as she looked from side to side for her enemy. Marv the Bus driver turned the wheel as he prepared to pull away from the school and speed on down the long country roads he traveled every day to return his load of rambunctious kids to their parents. “Oh my God look!”

“Oh that is HILARIOUS!”

"And you better get used to it." Bob responded, nonchalantly before hanging up.

"Oooooooh!" Emily huffed before ending the call on her end making her way back towards the others.

"No go, huh?" Jennifer asked.

"No, no go!" Emily said, fuming.

"So what are we going to do?" Adam said.

"Walk." Emily answered simply before lifting up her bag and leading the way.

It was a long walk out of the woods. As they started passing through the boonies, they briefly discussed the possibility of stopping by the house of one of their classmates to ask for a ride, but after their various dealings with the Collins' and O'Conner's today, they all decided against it. From their they proceeded to the long and winding road that lead into town. A few cars passed by, but they stuck to the bushes and managed to avoid detection. When the road gave way to a line of houses however, things began to look much, much bleaker.

"So, how do we want to do this?" Adam said as he stood upon the threshold.

"We could just run it." Jennifer said. "We're all pretty fast, and it's only a couple of blocks when you think about it. There don't seem to be too many people out..."

"No, it's a BUNCH of blocks, and we can't see very far ahead of us either." Emily contended. "We've got late night joggers, people coming home from work, kids out playing after school, people watching from windows, running last minute errands, no, we'll be seen for sure if we just streak it."

"So you've got a better idea?" Jennifer answered, a little miffed.

"Well, it's not great, but it's a little more practical if we're trying to avoid being seen. I say we run, but strategically. Pick out a hiding spot, run to that. Look for another hiding spot, then run to that...."

"That could take all night." Jennifer observed before Emily could finish.

"Better than giving the whole neighborhood a free show, don't you agree Adam?"

Reluctantly, Adam nodded his ascent. "Yeah, it does sound like the way to go. Sorry Jen."

Jennifer frowned a bit, but had to agree. "It's alright. It's the best plan. So, we make for the bushes in front of the Laturskiy place... then bolt for the shed by Mr. Glicks house?"

"Sounds good to me." Emily said, nodding. Since Adam didn't have any objections either, that's exactly what they did. They hid in the bushes for only a few moments, waiting for a car or two to pass by. Once the coast was clear, they shot across the street and hid behind Mr. Glick's shed, and in this fashion they made their way slowly into heart of town, ducking behind fences, crouching behind bushes and jumping into empty back yards. Their plan didn't hit a snag until they were a little more than half way home.

They had picked out a pretty precarious hiding place this time. All three of them were crouched down between two large SUV's, leaving them totally exposed on two sides. They knew they couldn't stay there long, so they quickly plotted a course for their next destination. It was a perilous course, a straight run down the block to Robinson's yard. The Robinson's were an old retired couple who'd left town months ago to travel the world, so their yard would be a safe bet to squat in for a few moments, but it was a block and a half away. Still, they were having a lot of success so far, and were thusly beginning to feel quite bold, and so, when the path looked clear, they left safety and took off running.

And it was that exact moment that the unmistakable sound of "pop goes the weasel" began to float through the air. An ice cream truck was coming round the corner, and it's siren call brought a whole flock of children rushing out from one of the nearby homes, just as Adam and Emily passed by, cutting them off from Jennifer who had been lagging but a few seconds behind. Shocked, Jennifer retreated back to the relative safety between the SUV's a split second before inevitable discovery. Adam was the first to realize Jen's misfortune. Stopping dead in his tracks, he grabbed Emily by the arm and stopped her progress, much to her chagrin.

"What are you doing!? Let me go!" She hissed, struggling to get free.

"Jen got cut off by the kids!" Adam countered urgently.

Emily looked back and didn't see her friend. She stopped struggling, but remained torn. She didn't want to abandon Jennifer, but she didn't want to stand stark naked in the middle of the street either! "We can still make it to the Robinson place!" She said at last. "Then we can come back for her!"

"It's too far!" Adam countered. "We can't let ourselves get separated like that! We have to..."

"Give me a boost!" Emily whisper-yelled.

Not having the time to argue, Adam did just that and boosted Emily up. Snagging onto a tree branch, Emily climbed up not the big old tree that had adorned Mr. Johnson's lawn since she was a little girl. "I can see Jen from up here!" Ems whispered. "We can hide in the tree until it's safe to go get her, come on up!" With that, Adam reached and took her hand. Unfortunately, Emily wasn't quite as strong as was necessary, and after a few moment of struggling, she lost her grip, sending Adam down to the ground into Mr. Johnson's yard.

Meanwhile, Jennifer was crouched in her hiding spot, eyes darting back and forth in nervous anticipation of what now seemed inevitable discovery. No one approached on the sides but, much to her dread, she could hear the Ice Cream truck coming closer and closer. Realizing it would pass by in mere seconds, Jennifer made a fateful decision and darted out from safety, taking shelter in front of the first SUV just as the Ice Cream truck pulled up alongside her old hiding spot. In her current spot, Jennifer could not be seen by the truck, or by the kids who were swarming all over her old hiding place, but she was now fully exposed on all but one side. Though she was crouched down with her front pressed against the bumper of the SUV, anybody walking up from any other direction would get a full and unobstructed view of her bare ass!

Adam hit the ground hard, so it took him a few moments to regain his senses. The good thing about Mr. Johnson's yard was that it was all fenced off, so Adam was fairly well hidden from anyone walking on the sidewalk. The bad thing was... well, just about everything else. Adam would realize this mere moments after regaining his senses. Just as he was preparing rise to his feet, he heard Emily whisper for him not to move from up in the tree overhead. He soon realized why. Mr. Johnson was in his yard, sitting down in a chair by his patio table, idly watering the lawn with a hose. So long as Adam remained at ground level, his body would remain obscured from view by the patio table at Mr. Johnson's side. So, just sit there and wait for Mr. Johnson to fall asleep or finish watering his lawn and go back inside, right? Well, there was another complication. See, Mr. Johnson had a dog. A pit bull as a matter of fact. A big, mean, nasty one, aptly named Jaws. Adam had landed right in front of the beast's dog house, with one leg on either side of it and his unprotected manhood presently mere inches from the sleeping monster's eponymous jaws!

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
(Originally authored by faith)

"Wonderful." Angie hissed as the metal door of the school closed behind them.

Bombarell, trailing behind, slowed by a combination of her high heels and attempting to negotiate her way outside without lowering the slim protection of her hands, muttered something in reply as she trailed behind.

Angie ground her teeth, turning around to glare at the scientist as the 'click-clack' of her heels grated on the police officer's last nerve. A sense of surreality struck her. Less than a day ago, she had been a respected member of her department, small though it was. She had been dedicated, strong-willed, determined to raise her sister and make their parents proud. She had always done her best to keep her little community safe. And up until last night, it had indeed been a safe, prosperous community- sure, with an occasional weirdness she had to deal with, but mostly comfortingly unremarkable. And now....her dignity was gone, her reputation was destroyed, her standing in the department was laughable, and her community was awash in walking dead and soon to be swimming with mind control drugs. And now....

"They're going after our children." Angie noted, looking squarely at Bombarell.

"Yes, officer. I am quite aware of that. We were both there, after all." Bombarell said woodenly.

"And this okay with you?" Angie demanded. "In case you haven't noticed, this thing is SPREADING! How many more people do you think are going to be caught up in all of this? Especially the people we care about!"

"First of all, what is it you think we can do? We need to obey the commands we are given. That makes resisting rather difficult, don't you think? Besides which, there's hardly anything else they can do to us. Why choose now to make an issue of it?"

Angie went livid for a moment. "Fucking hell-"

"Language!" Bombarell snapped.

"FUCK! I completely forgot who I was talking to. Seeing you with Adam in there makes it hard to remember who you really are. 'People we care about'. Fuck, what a joke. This whole thing is probably your wet dream- whole population exposed to your goddamn chemicals! There must be whole reems of data you can gather! And that's really the only goddamn thing you care about, right Lovebomb? Your little FUCKING experiment! You care about it so goddamn much your completely blind to how completely its gotten out of hand."

"There have been setbacks. Nothing more. Once I find a counteragent to the animating properties of my chemical, we'll have the zombie situation under control. For the time being, we just need to play their game, jump through their hoops and appear suitably chagrined and embarrassed about our predicament. For whatever reason, that seems to entertain the creatures....or perhaps just Bob. In any event-" Bombarell said, in the same tone she had given while lecturing the students.

"This IS embarrassing. Don't pretend your not completely mortified to be out here like this!" Angie spat.

"....which is precisely why it would serve us both to end this conversation and go our separate ways." Bombarell said curtly.

"What happens if they don't find this entertaining enough? What if they end up HURTING your son. Does that even bother you?"

"Enough. I have no intention of being lectured about my approach to my son or this situation by a naive girl 8 years my junior, least of all standing naked in a public school! I advice is do as your told. Fighting them will just make things worse. Now, good night, officer. I hope the next time we see each other the circumstances and your mood will have improved."

"You little-" Angie began, then cut herself off and stormed into the parking lot. Bombarell watched her go, catching herself admiring the firm yet shapely rear end of the police woman a bit too long. Sighing to herself, she shook her head, adjusted the strap on her red purse, and made her way in the opposite direction, craving the safety and semi privacy of her minivan.

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
(Originally authored by Faith)

The door to the black sedan opened slowly. The driver in the front seat, one of Bob's erstwhile gang members, turned its rotting face around slowly.

"Where are you going?" He asked as the figure in the back seat pulled itself from the vehicle.

"I have some errands to run." It said in a whisper, dressed in a ratty gown that had somehow survived the long burial period. "Perhaps you should go home as well. I doubt Bob needs you to give the little girl a ride home. In fact, I imagine he'd relish the thought of forcing the poor thing to ride one of those cramped yellow monstrosities that pass for a school bus these days. And my goodness he's so ambitious, with his little gangs and his plans for vengeance....I'm sure he has better things for you to do than skulk in a parking lot."

"Well, what about you?" The driver asked.

"Don't fret. I'll manage just fine." The whisper said.

The zombie in the car shrugged and started the engine. The dessicated thing in the gown slowly pulled a large butcher knife from its apron and shuffled into the parking lot.
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: Continue

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
(Originally authored by faith)

The nerve of that worthless police woman! How on earth did someone like that get anywhere in life? Innocent as the pure driven snow made for wonderful disney cartoons, but people like that ended up as secretaries and hair stylists with people like her! Stocism, careful planning, and absolute pragmatism were the keys to success.

Bombarell made her way to her vehicle, fuming at the exchange she had just had. The truth was, she was just as furious about the events that had transpired as Angie. But it was entirely useless to be angry- the zombies would do whatever they wanted, and Bombarell would just have to suffer through it. At least until she had the means to right this wrong once and for all.

Her mind lingered on her son. Did she need to worry about those two girls who were practically throwing themselves at him? No, probably not. Her son was intelligent....not as much as her, of course, but that was fine. He was handsome and polite, and did what she asked. He would be a fine and upstanding member of society.

Bombarell grimaced. Fine and upstanding, assuming this series of events didn't scar him for life. Bombarell liked to take an active interest in her son's life. Homework, social activities, and prospective dating partners were all painstakingly filed away in her head. But while she had occasionally had to warn off a potential harpy who took too active an interest in her son (girls today....skirts shorter than ever, brains emptier than ever, and all eager to steal away a young man's innocence and dignity at the drop of a hat!), she never punished him directly. It was perfectly normal for a young man to have a healthy interest in the opposite sex...or the same sex, for that matter. The fact that he was handsome and charming...well, as worrisome as that was when it came to attracting unwelcome attention, it wasn't his fault. She even admired that about him, in an abstract way.

She would never punish him for getting older, or becoming more handsome, or falling short of her standards. Stronger encouragement and rewards for success, that was the way to raise a child. She would never be like-

"Dear...." the voice came as a whisper, but it froze Bombarell's heart all the same. She whirled around, hands falling into there customary places, as always a vein attempt to keep her dignity.

"Don't slouch, dear. Stand up straight, hands at your side."

Bombarell obeyed immediately, her face burning. Another damn zombie.

"My my my. You've become quite the woman." The zombie mused.

"Is there something Bob wanted? What is it-" Bombarell began.

"Hush." The zombie whispered, pressing a large carving knife to bombarell's throat. Bombarell gasped, and her eyes widened.

"You never talked back in the old days. Bad habits creep in in the intervening period?" The woman whispered. Bombarell said nothing, the command keeping her silent.

"Saw your boy earlier. Looks like a fine young man. Strange though, you always said you hated kids. I never thought you'd make one for yourself...."

Bombarell's eyes widened.

"You don't seem quite as strict with him as I was with you. Which is a shame. He seems to have such potential. Look what I made out of you with a little firmer hand on the rudder! But then again, perhaps its providence. I made you into who you are, and you brought me back. Perhaps I can help raise the boy as well. After I discipline his mother, of course." The creature spoke, running the flat of the blade down Monica's throat.

"Mother...." Monica whispered.

"Don't speak." The woman whispered. "I need a few things from you. First, give me your purse."

Bombarell stared a moment, then robotically complied.

"Good girl." The zombie holstered the purse at her side. "I'm going to need a ride out of here, and I recall walking home seemed to do wonders for your behavior. There's really only two other things I need, dear. First, I need the answer to a little question that's been bothering me.....my death came so suddenly, such a strong and healthy woman....much too young, don't you think? I had a daughter to raise and an example to set. I lived a proper lifestyle. And yet there I went, out like a light....I was just curious, my little Bomby Poppy...."

Bombarell gulped.

"Did you...perhaps have something to do with that? Tell me the truth, now." The zombie said gently.

"You....you didn't leave me any choice! You kept punishing me! More and more the older I became! You were...you would have killed me. One night you'd have gone too far, left me outside too long or whipped me too hard...you were insane! I had to...." Bombarell whimpered.

"Dear, dear...its all right. I understand. I might have been...a little jealous. You looked so much like me, when I was young. I really couldn't stand that...I had been stuck with raising a daughter...I wasted my best years and all my looks on it. I know, envy is a sin. But then....I don't remember going to hell when I died. Maybe we can't remember where we went....its hard to say. But....I'm not sure there's anything waiting for me on the other side, Bomby Poppy....maybe you were right about that after all. But then, if there's nothing on the other side, why worry about being sinful now? And I do feel sinful dear. All that envy....can you imagine? A little extra age is nothing compared to....this. You and yours, with your pretty living flesh and warm blood....my my my, aren't you pretty?"

"Mother...." Bombarell whimpered.

"Oh dear...I'm not going to kill you. No no no...that sounds all too quick, doesn’t it? No, I think I’ll bide my time. Avoid trouble from that nasty Mr. Bob. But I do need something…a little token to balance the books. An eye for an eye, as it were. In fact, that sounds quite appropriate. You always were a reader, after all. I’ll take something precious to you, and then….Hold still dear, this won’t take long….the left one should do for today, don’t you thi-“

“Would you please…..” Angie whispered. “Fuck off?”

The nine millimeter in her hand went off a moment later. The hideous creature was flung back, so engrossed in its revenge it never so the naked police woman weaving through the parked cars. It hit the hood of a parked pick up hard, sporting a gaping wound oozing with the infamous chemicals as it got turned to stare.

“Sorry about the language.” Angie said casually, looking at Bombarell. The scientist just stared, open mouthed. “I wanted to answer that question you asked earlier.”

The mother rose to her feet, in time to meet a second bullet through the throat. Angie moved forward, firing a third into the monster’s throat.

“I think the way to fight them is actually pretty simple. You just have to pay attention to what your told.” Angie said, firing again as the monster tried to rise. “And when I thought about….you know what occurred to me?”

Another pop of the trigger. “Not once.” Bang. “Did they ever say.” Bang. “Not to.” Bang. “Shoot them with my gun. Funny, huh? All the humiliation, all the degradation, all the exploitation and enslavement and teasing….and they never once said ‘Don’t shoot me in the head’. Seems so basic.”

“It…it could be because its useless.” Bombarell whispered. “They won’t die that way.”

“Who says I was trying to kill her?” Angie asked.

The mother clawed her way to her feet, her face and throat a ruin of bullet holes. She locked eyes on the police woman, livid with anger. She opened her mouth, pointing a finger at the officer, and screamed.

Or tried. The sound that came out of her mouth was a hacking, throaty clicking, like a gasp of air from a chronic smoker. She continued to try to speak, a horrid fluid being hacked up by her mouth, zombie blood mixed with chunks of decayed flesh.

“Didn’t quite catch that, ‘dearie’.” Angie said. “We’re taught not to fire our weapons unless we have to. I’ve seen a lot of firearm victims, taken a lot of classes. Interesting what it does to a person’s throat, isn’t it? And sure, you might be rotting and undead and so you can take it….but you’ve still got lungs, you’ve still got a throat and tongue…and its still gonna be a miserable bitch to talk when someone unloads a cartridge into your face and blows off some of those accessories. Which makes it kind of hard to tell me to shoot myself in the head or stand still while you stab me or whatever else you were planning.”

The old woman glared at her, holding up the carving knife. Angie cocked an eyebrow. Taking in a deep breath, Angie charged forward, ducking a clumsy jab by the monster. Quickly grasping the hand that held the knife, Angie twisted it around. The cracking sound as the knife fell away was hideous.

Angie and the zombie glared at each other. Then Angie swung upwards while pulling the corpse down, her boot making hard contact with the thing’s face.

“Rotting, 70 pound body of slow moving atrophied muscles. Young, fit body of a 21 year old police officer, whose been trained in self-defense and ranked top in her class, thank you very much. This is not a good combination for you.” Angie warned.

The creature looked at her, and apparently agreed, for it fled a second later.

“Get back here!” Angie snapped, racing after it and grabbing the purse. The creature needed no further invitation as a clawed hand made a long cut across her forhead. Blood flowed into her eyes, and Angie fell back. When she had recovered, the zombie wasn’t anywhere to be seen.
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: Continue

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
(Originally authored by Faith)

“Fuck!” Angie snapped, the pain from the cuts surprisingly sharp. Her breathing heavy, the deputy turned and walked back to Bombarell.

She found the scientist clutching her hands over her mouth, kneeling on the asphalt. She paused, took in a deep breath, then nodded.

“She’s gone.”

Bombarell looked up at her, then got unsteadily to her feet. She stared at the police woman for a long moment, as if she was working on a math problem she couldn’t solve.

“Why?” She said at last.

“Why what?” Angie asked, disgruntled.

“Why save me?” Bombarell said simply, climbing to her feet and dusting herself off.

Angie gave her a look. “Why is that even a question? What else was I going to do when someone tries to cut your eye out?”

Bombarell glowered at her. Then shook her head. “Were you even thinking? What would have happened if she had seen you? Or if you hadn’t hurt her as badly as she thought you could? Or if she had stabbed you?”

Angie glowered right back. “No, I didn’t think. I just acted. That’s what I do. If I hesitate, if I ever hesitate, people die!”

“Your too naïve.” Bombarell said. “Your living in a world full of predators, and all they need is a second of good samaritanship to tear you apart.”

“Well, I sure as hell didn’t ask you! Believe me, if I chose who I saved based on personality, I wouldn’t have come anywhere near-“

“Thank you.”

“……what?” Angie said, mid-rant.

“Thank you. Isn’t that the customary response when you’re helped?” Bombarell asked.

“Errr….yes….but I’ve never heard you say it before.” Angie said.

“Well, I’ve never found myself stripped by reanimated corpses, forced to wander about my office on display for every idiot who wants to look, forced to watch my child subjected to the same ordeal, and then been saved from mutilation by a woman who has every reason to hate me! So….I wouldn’t get used to it.” Bombarell said.

“….Your welcome.” Angie said.

“Well…..” Bombarell trailed off. “In any case….”

“I’ll…see you later.” Angie said, trailing off, feeling odd and awkward and every inch as thoroughly naked as she was.

“Angie!” Bombarell screamed a second later. A huge minivan, tires squeeling, began boring down on the police officer the moment she stepped out from the rows of cars. Angie’s eyes widened as it came for her, for a moment stuck like a dear in headlights. It was only the long arm snaking over her shoulder and yanking her away that saved her. She and Bombarell fell backwards. The pair ended up on the hood of a car, Bombarell on her back with Angie pressed on top of her. Their breasts were squeezing together, their eyes were locked on one another, and their legs were entangled such that both girls had a knee pressed against the other’s sex.

“……thanks….” Angie whispered, blushing and short of breath.

“….your welcome.” Bombarell replied.

“What was that?” Angie asked.

“I believe…that was my car…and my mother inside it…” Bombarell said softly.

“You saved my life.” Angie observed.

“Yes, well…there seems to be a lot of that going around tonight.” Bombarell whispered. “….I don’t suppose I could have a ride?”

“Umm….sure. Your not going to like it, though.” Angie said.

“Let me guess….the zombie have found a new way to humiliate you?” Bombarell asked.

“Good guess.” Angie whispered as she slid off the scientist. Bombarell sat up, eyes roving over the female officer.

“I really don’t understand you.” She said at last. “I think your naïve, kind to a fault, stubborn, and a complete fool.”

Angie paused, and took in a breath to let Bombarell know what she was thought of.

“And you just saved me from my own mother.” Bombarell said as she rose off the car, standing close enough to the cop for their breasts to again press up to each other. “In what was….an impressive display of…competence and bravery…and profiency….”

“Your trying to say I kicked her ass.” Angie supplied helpfully.

“Actually, I was trying to everything but say it.” Bombarell said. “I still think you’re an idiot, you know. Your just….a very brave and very skilled idiot.”

“Uh-huh. Sooooo….if that’s the sort of thing an idiot would do, why save me from the oncoming car?” Angie asked.

Bombarell shrugged.

“Look….Bombarell…I’m a cop. Its what I do. Its what I promised I’d be, what I’ve always wanted to be. Its my passion. I protect people. I save lives.”

“You give trite speeches about your profession.” Bombarell said dryly. “You…can call my Monica, if you want.”

“All right….Monica….what I mean is, you might not be a cop, and you might not have as long a list as me, but there are still people you’d protect from anything, right? Your son, for example….”

“My son…we see how good I’ve been at that…” Monica said, pulling away from the cop.

“Bom- Monica, this isn’t your fault.” Angie said.

“Really? I didn’t dump those chemicals in the ground? I didn’t bring back the dead, including that witch I put down in the first place?” Monica asked.

“It was a mistake. You said so yourself. And if I’d listened to you, maybe we could have stopped them.” Angie said. It took her a second to note tears on Monica’s face.

“You heard her talking, right? I’m a murderer. I killed her, and I never had any regrets. So tell me what that makes me in your innocent little world, Miss Summers.” Monica said.

“……” Angie paused. Monica nodded and turned away.

“Your not a monster.” Angie said a moment later. “Your not like them. Your not malicious....as malicious as they are. You don’t revel in people’s pain the way they do. And your not like the fuckers I’ve picked off the street, either.”

“You don’t know me. I love to take down people in my way. I love to humiliate them, to see fear in their eyes. I love crushing them. I loved the look on your face when I convinced your sister you were an addict. I loved-“

“I didn’t say you weren’t a bitch.” Angie said dryly. “Your arrogant, your prideful, you think you’re the only one who can accomplish anything because no matter how smart you are…and you are fucking brilliant….no matter, you’re never as smart as you think you have to be. And you don’t ever trust anyone else. You drive me fucking crazy, you know! But don’t ask me to call you a monster, because I’ve seen real monsters- undead or otherwise, and sorry Monica…your not one of them.”

“……my mother was.” Monica whispered. “She loved punishing me. Sometimes she would make me stand naked outside for hours.”
“…….yeah, that sounds awful.” Angie said sarcastically, cocking an eyebrow and gesturing at their current circumstances.

“In the rain.” Monica said. “And the snow.”

“Oh.” Angie said.

“She was fond of spanking me in front of the neighborhood. Or tying me to a tree in the backyard and whipping me in the nude. Everyone knew. The drunken apes next door would line up to watch through our back fence.” Monica said softly.

“…..so maybe you have a good reason not to trust people.” Angie said. “But your not like her, if that’s what’s on your mind.”

“Really?” Monica asked. “I worry sometimes…what will happen to Adam when he gets older? Am I doing it right.”

“Err….well, you could probably stand to monitor him a little less…and let him go out with the people he likes more often….” Angie began.

“I wasn’t asking for-“

“But really, I think your doing fine. You’re a little domineering, but your not abusive. I think, given that you managed to go from being raised by a horrible monster and just turned out to be a massive bitch that your son can go on and be a fairly decent and rounded human being.” Angie said.

“Your obvious adoration of the phrase ‘bitch’ aside….thank you.” Monica said. “I…Angie, I have a favor to ask.”

“All right.” Angie said.

“Please watch over my son.” Monica said. “You were right. I…I’m terrified of what might happen to him. And….I trust you…”

“…….really?” Angie asked.

“W-well, its just that your worldview seems entirely genuine, if overly naïve and foolish, and while in general I find that brand of stupidity to be worrisome, it does have its uses, and one of them-“

“I’ll do my best.” Angie snapped. “I can’t promise I’ll be able to protect him from those motherfuckers, but I’ll give everything I’ve got to it. I’ll give it to my sister and you, even if one of you is a massive cunt.”

“Language! And your sister didn’t seem that bad.” Monica smirked.
“…..can I ask you a favor?” Angie asked.

“….of course.” Monica said after a pregnant pause.

“Find a way to kill these things for good. I’ll keep us safe if you end this once and for all.” Angie said.

“Ah. Of course.” Monica said.
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: Continue

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
(Originally authored by faith)

“…..you should stay and my house tonight.” Angie said.

“What?” Monica said.

“She took your car. She had your ID. She knows where you live now. I’ve got a shotgun, two ex-police dogs, and a nice big lock on my door. You’ll be safer.” Angie said.

“And we would explain this to them how?” Monica asked.

“Umm….you want to monitor my situation more closely?” Angie offered.

“Mmmm…and your certain this is an entirely altruistic gesture on your part, and not an attempt to use me to relieve all those insufferable urges you’ve been having as a result of the zombie chemicals?” Monica asked.

“Wha? Well…I wasn’t going to…I’m just worried, okay? And…well, so it did cross my mind that maybe we could….well, I’m starting to warm up to you a little….and we both want to, you know, all the time now, and this was one of the few ways we could…but we have extra rooms if you’d rather-“ Angie stammered.

Monica’s lips locked with her before she could finish.

“Don’t be silly officer. Its an excellent solution to a mutual problem. And besides…as you said, I’m very poor at offering thanks when its deserved. So…seeing you so efficiently protecting me…I think its worth quite a bit of admiration and gratitude, don’t you? I should like a chance to….PROPERLY express both emotions….and a full night in a large bed should allow me to do just that.”

The kiss was longer and deeper this time, with Angie moaning softly as Monica pressed her tightly to herself, her free hand fondling her hips and butt.

“Of course…this assumes I want to wait that long.” Monica whispered.

Angie gulped. They both knew that risking another ‘public viewing’ was about the worst thing they could do to themselves, but the drugs and the warm body pressed against bare skin was making a compelling argument not to care anymore.
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: Continue

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
Lips and bodies pressed together, hands roving from one erogenous zone to another, the good cop and the mad scientist allowed their guards to drop completely, surrendering to the constant sexual pressure they had endured all day. With a wet smack, their lips parted as Monica began planting a trail of kisses down her desperate lover's neck, a trail leading closer and closer towards her massive breasts. Throwing her head back, Angie moaned as the doctor went to work on her nipples. Though her moan was one of pleasure, it was wrought with conflict as well. "Mmm... No, Monica, stop... we can't do this… not here..."

"I know, I know..." The doctor replied, stopping briefly between each "know" to suck on Angie's nips. "We'll have to be quick, we can do this very very..."

Angie's eyes shot open at the sound of rapidly approaching footsteps and shouts of concern. Broken out of her trance, Angie grabbed her would be lover by the shoulders and turned her around. Though agitated and perturbed at first, Lovebomb quickly realized the gravity of the oncoming situation, gasped, and did her best to get herself under control. It was no easy task. Her heart was racing, her breathing heavy, her sex aching, but now was absolutely not the time. Before the footsteps arrived, she, like Angie, covered herself up as best she could as the interested party stopped right in front of them.

The party consisted of Principal Wormkins, his VP, Mrs. Soffen, Greg the security guard, and Sandra Cardinalis, the reporter from the local news station who had taped the whole ludicrous assembly, with her camera crew only a few breaths behind her. Sandra was asking questions faster than the two startled women could hear them, but the Principal stepped in front of her and interjected, speaking more slowly and with greater concern. "My God! Are you two alright? What happened out here? We heard gunshots!"

"Y-yes..." Monica stammered, fighting to maintain control of her voice. "I was nearly mugged at knife point! But Deputy Summers was able to scare off my attacker, who merely made off with my car, instead of my life!"

"Don't worry everyone, the thief is gone, everything's under control." Angie added, seeing the growing fear and worry on the school staff's faces.

Miss Cardinalis was not convinced, however. "Really? That was an awful lot of shots we heard. What did the..."

"My God, Angie! Your bleeding!" Wormkins said, cutting the reporter off.

It was true. Though the blood had stopped flowing from her head wound, Angie's face was still stained red. In all of the confusion, and the passion, she must have forgotten.

"Yes... the perp, she got in a lucky shot." Was her reply.

"Greg, take Miss Summers to the nurses office, will you?" The principal ordered.

"Sure thing. Come on sweety, let’s get you all patched up." The security guard said, leading Angie back towards the school. Angie wasn't sure how okay she was being called "sweety" but it would be nice to get her wound taken care of, so she didn't object.

Once Angie was gone, Sandra looked back at her camera man and told him to get ready. "Excuse me, Miss Bombarell. I know this must be a trying time for you, but do you think we could get an interview?"
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: They get interrupted by a camera crew looking f...

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
Monica frowned. She didn't want to give an interview. Aside from the obvious fact that being seen naked on local TV was not high on her list of life goals (even if they'd have to blur out her naughty bits) she was still rattled from the confrontation with her mother, and revisiting the event, and lying about it on camera without Angie around to properly corroborate the story was about the last thing she wanted to do right now.

"I'm sorry, but, your right. It has been a very trying day for me, so I must respectfully decline. I will fill out a police report on the event with Deputy Summers, and that will be the end of it." Monica was very careful to phrase her refusal as politely as possible without sounding insincere. She was still very aware of the seeming curse placed upon her by the Zombies, her so called "five senses apology system." She had yet to explore the full limits of the system, and she had no intention of doing so with a camera nearby.

"Are you sure?" Sandra replied. "I have to say, things are not looking good for you right now, or this school, or this town for that matter. This might be your last chance to set the record straight before events begin to spin totally out of your control."

"Wait, wait, what are you talking about?" Wormkins interjected before Monica could reply. "You heard the deputy, everything is under control. This was just an isolated incident that..."

"Please!" Sandra exclaimed, cutting the principal off. "After what I've seen today, you expect me to believe that everything's under control? From what I've seen, this town has a very serious drug and crime problem that it's trying very hard to hide. I mean, honestly, this whole drug free-clothes free angle? That has to be the most insanely desperate attempt to whitewash a scandal I've ever seen! And then, on the way out there's a goddamn shooting in the parking lot, and you expect me to believe it was just a random mugging?"

"Excuse me!" Monica said, loudly, struggling to gain control of the situation. "I don't expect you to believe anything, young lady. The deputy and I already told you what happened. I was just robbed and threatened at knife-point in broad daylight, I don't need to submit myself to your scrutiny."

"Ahem, excuse me Miss Cardinalis..." Mrs. Soffen interjected. "What exactly do you think happened here?"

"Well, since you asked so nicely..." Sandra replied. "This sounds like a drug shooting to me, plain and simple. Maybe Deputy Summers isn't as cleaned up as she'd like us to think she is. Maybe she owes money to dealers, or maybe they don't like the fact that she's going public about this new drug you're all so excited about. It could be anything, but it seems like an awfully big coincidence for this to happen right here, right now, in a neighborhood that hasn't had a serious crime in I don't know how long."

"Now, now, hold on there, I think your jumping to conclusions..." Wormkins uttered, turning a bit pale.

"I'll say." Monica added. The reporter was wrong of course. In this case, she wasn't jumping nearly far enough with her conclusions to hit the bizarre mark of reality.

"Well, that's what I think. I'll simply report the events as I understand them, and we'll let the authorities, and the viewing public, draw their own conclusions. I think 7 or 8 shots is a little much to scare off a thug with a knife, don't you think?"

"Miss Cardinalis, please, let’s discuss this!" Wormkins implored. "Now, we were nice enough to call you in to cover this story, exclusively, I might add, and..."

"And you think that entitles you to something?" The reported interrupted. "Let me ask you something, when you asked me to come here, did you really expect me to just swallow all of this and spin it the way you want it to be spun? I don't know what you think you know about me, or my station, but I'm a legitimate journalist. If I smell a rat, I'm going to report on it, and let me tell you, this place is rat INFESTED! How could you expect anyone to look at all of this and conclude that your town is safe, your school is under control, and this whole bizarre public nudity program is a reasonable response to the situation? Your students practically rioted after that assembly! This whole place is out of control! So, give me an interview, don't give me an interview, I don't care, but that's the story, and that's what I'm going to report on!"

Wormkins looked like he was about to faint. Monica was fuming, trying to control herself and not say something that she would regret sooner rather than later. Luckily, Mrs. Soffen was fast enough on her feet to spring to the rescue once again.

"So, this story of yours, this is a pretty big one for you, isn't it?" Mrs. Soffen began. "Not much happens around these parts, not much of interest anyway." It was true. Mrs. Soffen was thinking in particular of a very slow news day, where Sandra spent several hours conducting live, up to the minute reporting on the activities of a small burrowing mammal on groundhog's day, a personal low point for her career.

"Yes, of course. It's the kind of thing the public wants to know." Was Sandra's reply. She had been preparing to leave, but had now stopped in her tracks.

"Of course." Mrs. Soffen continued. "But, it does have certain... story elements... that will attract people more than others."

Cardinalis couldn't help but smile. "Well, I won't lie. There's a certain segment of our audience that will turn up the volume once they see "naked “ and “school" plastered across the screen."

"Indeed." Mrs. Soffen replied. "So, you make your report, throw all of us under the bus... wrongfully, I might add… and then what? You can cover the fallout of course, but for the most part, the story is over. No more students naked in school. I believe you are correct to a certain extent, Miss Cardinalis. All of this is an elaborate act of desperation, but we're not trying to hide anything. We're just trying to preserve what peace we have in this quiet little town. Would things really be improved here if this picturesque middle American school were to be torn apart? To say nothing of the Summers and Bombarell families, sure to be destroyed if all of this isn't handled just right? Report on that, Miss Cardinalis, and you'll get more out of this story than one night of extra interest and a journalistic feather in your hat. We're trying to do good things here Miss Cardinalis, but we can't do it without your support."

Sandra paused for a long moment, thinking it over, and soon she began to smile. Mrs. Soffen smiled too. She was actually going to go for it!
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: Pressed

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
Meanwhile, in the School Nurse's Office, Angie was sitting on the exam table, eyes closed and head tilted back as the nurse bandaged her head wound.

"Just take it easy for oooone more minute, we're almost done." Donna, the school nurse had a reassuring and gentle bedside manner that usually had the effect of putting students at ease. In the rare cases where Donna's presence did not have the desired effect of calm reassurance however, her manner was hardly to blame. While she was a pretty woman, she wasn't exactly model material. Her hips were too wide, her skin too pale, and just a little too much junk in the trunk to make it into a magazine. But what she did have, was a massive rack that her uniform had a habit of accentuating. Other than that, she was a smart, pretty girl with red hair and blue eyes, but those boobs of hers had sent more than a few hypnotized school boys running to the office when they should have been hitting the books.

"Aaaaaand we're done! How's that feel?" The nurse asked.

Reaching up to touch the bandages, Angie nodded her head. "Good as new, thanks doc. Now, if you don't mind, I've got to be..."

It was at this point that Angie noticed the small boy holding a hall pass waiting in the doorway. Angie Had been sitting on the exam table, leaning back on her hands while the nurse worked on her, meaning that her beautiful breasts were both on full display the whole time. What’s more, she had gotten, perhaps a bit too comfortable, allowing her knees to drift apart, leaving her legs wide open, and her crotch in full view from the door. The boy, who had been standing there for god knows how long, was stock still, with his mouth wide open.

"Oh, hello Timmy!" Donna said. "Trouble with your tummy again?"

Blushing from head to toe, Angie hopped up off the table and retrieved her hat from the counter top where it had lain the whole time. Placing the hat upon her head, she quickly thanked the nurse one more time before covering up and heading for the door. As she passed the awestruck kid, she wracked her mind for something to say, and settled on "Uhm... stay in school!" before heading back outside to join Dr. Lovebomb and the others back in the parking lot.
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: The Nurse's Office

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
Outside, the deal reached the point of its final deliberations, as Sandra Cardinalis repeated the terms one more time.

"So, I report on the events as I've seen them, glossing over the riot after the assembly, and shooting in the parking lot, and drawing any unfortunate implications from any of these strange happenings. I tell the viewing audience what you mean by all of this, making no judgments of my own, and in exchange for that, I get exclusive and unlimited coverage of everything going on at this school. Is that right?"

"I think that sounds reasonable." Soffen answered, but Wormkins wasn't so sure.

"Uhm... now just hold on a minute, what exactly do you mean by 'unlimited coverage?'"

"Well, exactly what it means Principal Wormkins. I have unlimited access to the school, any time, day or night. I can set up cameras wherever and whenever I like to get the footage I need for my news segments. Also, any students I wish to interview will be made available to me upon request."

The Principal looked crestfallen. You could hardly blame him. His school was changing for the worse so fast he could hardly believe it himself. "I'm almost afraid to ask..." he said. "Does that include the locker rooms?"

Sandra smiled. "Jennifer, Emily and Adam are all on sports teams aren't they?"

"Well, Adam is on the football team, but Jennifer and Emily are cheerleaders..." Wormkins replied.

"They all use the locker facilities for changing and showering though, right?"

"Well, yes..."

"Then I think that would be a very useful venue for interviews, don't you? Catch them after performing in front of a live audience, adrenaline pumping... it'd be a real opportunity to get a more intimate glimpse into what’s going on in their heads. To say nothing of the perspectives of their teammates..."

"Well now, I can see how that would seem attractive to you, Miss Cardinalis, but I don't know if I can in good conscience... I mean, these are kids and..."

" Principal Wormkins, you have 3 kids walking the halls of the school in their birthday suits as we speak! You can't honestly preach to me about preserving the modesty of your students with a straight face can you? Besides, reporters go into the locker rooms of professional athletes for post game interviews all the time. It's really no big deal. Your students might even enjoy the extra attention, being made to feel like big time professional athletes and all of that. And I won't be airing footage of their naughty bits either, if that's what you’re afraid of. Channel 6 has broadcasting standards you know! Trust me, it will all be tastefully done. You have nothing to worry about."

Wormkins looked uneasy, but at last he admitted defeat. "Alright, you can have what you want."

"So long as you remain sympathetic to our struggles." Mrs. Soffen added.

"Oh, trust me, you have my absolute sympathy." Sandra said, smiling. She was smiling wider on the inside. She'd play ball with them as long as she could manage, dragging the spectacle out as long as it was profitable, all the while collecting and annotating every example of corruption and dubiousness she could find. Then, when the time was right, she'd broadcast her big expose, blowing the top off of the whole affair. She'd have her ratings, and the acclaim that comes along with being a crusading journalist. Who says you can't have your cake and eat it too?

Sandra continued. "As important as unlimited access is to the school, I'd also like to set up a similar arrangement for the Summers, Bombarell and Nurelli homes. Their exciting nude lives aren't limited only to the walls of this school after all..."

That Monica couldn't allow. Aside from the obvious invasion of privacy, she couldn't afford to be under 24 hour surveillance. Not when the zombies could come calling at any moment, not when her horrid mother could show up on her doorstep when least expected. And something told her that Bob didn’t want cameras in his house either. It was an impossibility. "I'm sorry, I can't consent to that, and I know Angie...Deputy Summers would feel the same way."

"I don't see why." Sandra pressed. "Isn't part of your aversion therapy program the idea that constant exposure..."

"No." Monica cut her off. "We need a time and place where we can have peace. I'm trying to break Deputy Summers of a bad habit, not drive her insane. By that same token, Adam, Jennifer and the Nurelli girl have all given far too much of themselves already, and I will not put them on display for you 24/7. We'll be happy, I'm sure, to give you interviews when you need them, and if you require domestic footage for your reports, we'll be happy to schedule that as well, but I refuse to completely surrender the privacy of my family to you."

"Are you sure about that?" Sandra said, quirking an eyebrow. She had managed to get quite a lot out of Wormkins and his VP, but Monica seemed stubborn and resistant. She wondered how far she could be pushed. "What if I said that the rest of this deal is out of the window if I don't get exactly what I want?"

"Now, now hold on there a minute...!" Wormkins stammered. Monica was about to speak, when the sound of Angie's voice approaching answered for her.

"I'd say that sounds like a bluff, Miss Cardinalis." Within moments, Angie, who'd overheard enough of the conversation to get the gist of the situation, was at Monica's side, backing her up in front of the conniving reporter. "You wouldn't have come this far if you didn't want something out of this arrangement. What the Doctor said goes for me as well. That's a compromise you’re going to have to accept if you want this thing to go any further than today."

Sandra thought about it for a moment, and then, at last, relented. "Alright, fine. Deal. That acceptable to everyone?"

Everyone nodded. It was the only arrangement they could think of to keep the whole charade together. Sandra continued. "Good. So, now that that's all cleared up, how about that interview?"

"'Cause this is Thriller! Thriller night! And no one's gonna save you from the beast about to strike! You know it's Thriller! Thriller night! Your fighting for your life inside a killer, thriller tonight!"

For once, Angie was almost glad to hear the sound of that damn cell phone. "Sorry, I have to take this. Official police business, you understand." With that she turned around and started walking towards her bike. Flustered, Sandra turned to Monica expectantly, but received only a brief smile. "I'm afraid I can't stay and chat either. She's my ride. Maybe some other time..."

With that, Monica turned around and hurried to catch up with Angie who had already pulled the cellphone out of the pouch on her belt. Immediately, Dr. Bombarell began listening in on the conversation already in progress.

"I told you two to call me as soon as you got out. What happened?"

"We've got problems Bob... serious problems."

"Now Angie, I know you’re not going to go and disappoint me now, are you? Because if that Assembly didn't go exactly how I wanted it, I'm going to be very disappointed, and that means I'm going to have to find some other way to amuse myself."

"The assembly went the way it was supposed to go." Angie said, disgusted. "You got what you wanted."

Bob's mood seemed to brighten. "So, all three kids, get to go to school bare ass naked from now on?"

"...Yes. My sister, Monica's son, and your little spy."

"Heh, yeah, I bet she must have been surprised. And watch your mouth. That's my granddaughter you’re talkin about. How'd she take it?"

"About as... hold on..."

Angie held one hand over the phone's speaker and crossed her arm once again over her chest. As one, she and Monica turned around to see Sandra running after them with a card in each hand. "Sorry we couldn't get you on tape today, but, here's my card. Whenever you’re ready to set something up, just give me a call. Don't keep me waiting." With that she held up the two cards, one in each hand, and shoved them right into Monica and Angie's cleavage. Smiling smugly, Sandra said "Well, goodbye. I won't take up any more of your time." Before turning and heading off in the other direction.

Sighing, Angie waited for Monica to pluck the card out from between her boobs before returning to the phone.
1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.title: Re-Pressed

1153322121112121221221111111111112121112.content:
"Sorry Bob, but..."

"Did you just put me on hold, Angie?"

"It couldn't be helped. This reporter came up to give us business cards."

"Reporter huh? She the nosy kind?"

Angie didn't want to answer. Truth be told, she didn't really like Sandra Cardinalis all that much, but she also knew that if Bob perceived the woman as a threat she could be in very real danger, and that's not something Angie wants on her conscience. Unfortunately, she was still under the spell of the Zombie goo, and thus compelled to tell her master the truth when he asks for it.

"Yes. Very."

"Well now, she could be a problem. If there's one thing I hate more than do-gooder cops, its nosy reporters. We may just have to put a leash on her too. Is she the big deal that’s got you so worked up?"

"No, it's something else."

“Well, don’t keep me in suspense. Tell me.”

"Alright... just a second... Monica, would you rather...?"

"Give me the phone." Was Monica's response. "Hello, Bob."

"Hey, sweet cheeks! Nice to hear the sound of your voice again. So, tell me, what’s got your hypothetical panties in a bunch?"

"After the assembly, one of your goons broke off from the pack and attacked me in the parking lot."

There was silence on the other end of the line. Bob was rebuilding an empire here. He had a second chance at life, apparent immortality, and the power to control the minds of the living. Everything had been going so well so far... perhaps he had begun to take the loyalty of his fellow dead heads for granted. If this was going to be a problem, he'd have to start making greater efforts to ensure discipline. Exerting exactly enough concentration to keep his temper in check, Bob spoke again, in a cold, executioner's voice. "Who?"

"It was my mother, Rachel Bombarell. I didn't recognize her until she confronted me... her features were disguised by years of rot and decay. She'd been lying in wait all of this time waiting for the opportunity to get at me while I was alone, but Angie was able to frighten her away."

"What did she want from you?"

"Revenge. I... I killed her. She wants to punish me. She was going to begin by taking my eye."

Bob remained quiet for a few moments. He knew Bombarell was eccentric... maybe even a little mad, but he had thought her too academic and intellectual a person for cold blooded murder. He'd have to take that into account in the future. "Where is she now?"

"I don't know. She drove off in my car. She's had access to my purse, and all the information within, so I'm fairly certain she knows where I live now. Angie has suggested that Adam and I move in with her and her sister, at least until this situation is resolved...."

"...And you'll explain to the kids that this is all part of your experiment, so you can monitor Angie more closely. Good. Go with that. I'll send some of my boys out to monitor the area around your house, around the school and around your work, yours AND Angie's. If your mom is stupid enough to try anything, they'll grab her, and she'll answer to me."

"What are you planning to do?"

"Make an example out of her. That's all you need to know. Until we catch her, be on the lookout. If she's half as smart as you..."

"She's not."

"Don't interrupt. If she's half as smart as you, she'll find you eventually if we don't catch her first. This is your life, and the life of your kid we're talking about here, so don't get cocky. Me and the boys, we've been having fun with you. Believe me, this woman is a whole different ball game. Vengeance from beyond the grave is powerful stuff. You can't even begin to imagine what that kind of hatred feels like. Don't fuck around with it. Get paranoid, you hear?"

"I hear you, Bob."

"Good. Now call your kids and mine and tell them they're taking the bus home tonight. You need to get back to the lab and get cracking on that job I put you on, and Angie needs to clean up that mess at the graveyard ASAP, you got me?"

"Yes, Bob."

"Great. Put Angie back on the phone."

Gratefully, Monica passed Angie the phone. She said hello, and Bob started up again.

"You got some way of screening your calls, Angie?"

"I've got caller ID."

"What’s that?"

"It's a feature on my house phone, it lets you know who's calling."

"Great. You be careful about that now, you hear? All she needs to do is look you up in the yellow pages and find herself a phone. I could station an army of Zombies out on your front lawn, and if you pick up that phone, you'd be a dead woman. I'll tell you the same thing I told the rocket scientist, get paranoid."

"I can take care of myself." Angie said, confidently.

"Yeah, well we'll see won't we? Get back to work. I'll get a more complete report on the day’s events later."

With that, Bob hung up the phone.

"Hmph..." Angie exclaimed closing the phone and putting it back into her belt.

"What?" Monica asked.

"I think this has really gotten under his skin. He didn't even say goodbye."

"Heh. The rudeness of people these days. It's the end of the world."

***

Bob leaned back on the couch and gazed down at the cellphone in his hand. "Shit." He thought to himself. His entire scheme counted on the support of his fellow ghouls. Without them, he was just a lone, undead, brain eating monster. Things had been going so well too. And now this one rogue Zombie threatened to tear the whole thing apart. She couldn't survive long on her own, that's for sure. Without her daughter to provide her with the Zombie Tranquilizing serum, she'd degenerate into a mindless brain eating beast eventually. And then what? She'll kill, and she'll kill, and the people she kills will get up and they'll kill, and they wouldn't be able to keep that secret for very long.
